executable.title: N4ITK MRI Bias correction
executable.description: Performs MRI bias correction using N4 algorithm. This module is based on the ITK filters contributed in the following publication: Tustison N, Gee J "N4ITK: Nick's N3 ITK Implementation For MRI Bias Field Correction", The Insight Journal 2009 January-June, http://hdl.handle.net/10380/3053
executable.contributor: Nick Tustison (algorithm and ITK implementation), Andrey Fedorov (Slicer wrapping)
executable.acknowledgements: The development of this module was partially supported by NIH grants R01 AA016748-01 and R01 CA111288, as well as by NA-MIC, NAC, NCIGT and the Slicer community.

image.name: inputImageName
image.label: Input Image
image.description: Input image with MRI field inhomegeneity

image.name: maskImageName
image.label: Mask Image
image.description: Mask of the structure of interest in the input image. Optional, but highly recommended.

integer-vector.name: numberOfIterations
integer-vector.label: Number of iterations
integer-vector.description: Number of iterations at each level, separated by comma

float-vector.name: initialMeshResolution
float-vector.label: BSpline grid resolution
float-vector.description: Initial resolution of the bspline grid: resolution in each of the 3 dimensions separated by comma

float.name: splineDistance
float.label: Spline distance
float.description: Distance between spline points; valid only if mesh resolution is not specified

integer.name: shrinkFactor
integer.label: Shrink factor
integer.description: Specifies upsampling scale for the input image. Should be defined as a non-zero number. 1 corresponds to no upsampling, and will result in the slowest execution.

integer.name: bsplineOrder
integer.label: BSpline order
integer.description: Order of the BSpline used for fitting

float-vector.name: histogramSharpening
float-vector.label: Histogram sharpening
float-vector.description: A vector of up to three values. Non-zero values correspond to Bias Field Full Width at Half Maximum, Wiener filter noise, and Number of histogram bins.
